definition: to block (a road)/to plug (a hole)/to stop up
to block up (a road, pipe etc)/to stop up (a hole)/(fig.) (of a person) choked up with anxiety or stress/wall (literary)/(classifier for walls)
to die/impassable/uncrossable/inflexible/rigid/extremely/damned

sentences.english: As he was getting the horse ready to set off, he found that the road was blocked.
sentences.chinese: 準備備馬啓程時，卻發現路已經被堵死了。

sentences.english: He never closed the door to compromise.
sentences.chinese: 他從不把妥協的門堵死。

sentences.english: The doors and windows had been bricked up to prevent squatters from getting in.
sentences.chinese: 所有門窗已被用磚堵死，以防蹲伏的動物進入。

sentences.english: Before charging work is started, the drill holo is plugged.
sentences.chinese: 開始裝藥以前，先將炮眼下端眼口堵死。

sentences.english: Asked about the possibility of spinoffs, Mr. Pandit didn't slam the door.
sentences.chinese: 當被問及拆分的可能性時，潘偉迪並沒有把路堵死。

sentences.english: The cumbersome eighteen-wheeled vehicle was spread across the road, blocking all traffic movement.
sentences.chinese: 這臺笨重的十八輪車輛橫躺在路上，把交通全堵死了。

sentences.english: Traffic on the road slowed to a standstill. Dozens of police officers were called in.
sentences.chinese: 路堵死了，幾十個警察到了現場。

sentences.english: The road is completely blocked by a broken-down car.
sentences.chinese: 一輛汽車出了故障，整條路都被堵死了。

sentences.english: Eugenie's room was opposite this blocked door.
sentences.chinese: 這扇堵死的門對面是歐也妮的房門。

sentences.english: I got stuck in traffic. I tried to call your cell phone, but it was busy.
sentences.chinese: 我被堵死了，試着打你的手機，可是一直佔線。

definition: to block up
to block up (a road, pipe etc)/to stop up (a hole)/(fig.) (of a person) choked up with anxiety or stress/wall (literary)/(classifier for walls)
a way out/a way to retreat/leeway
to break or cut in two/to sever/to cut off/(fig.) to cut off (a conversation, a flow etc)/to interrupt/(math.) to truncate
to blockade/to seal off
escape route/retreat route/communication lines to the rear/alternative course of action/room for maneuver
nowhere to go/at the end of one's tether
to cut off/to sever
to drive away
to obstruct
to stop/to resist/to obstruct
to detour/to bypass/to circumvent/to avoid/to wind around (of a road etc)
to jam/to choke/to clutch/also pr. [qia3 zhu4]
to burst/to break through/to topple
won't work/will get (you) nowhere
labor/physical work
through road/way out/way to survive/means of subsistence
